data.title: Tunku Abdul Rahman University of Management and Technology Visits Nanchang University
data.meta_description: On September 8, a delegation from Tunku Abdul Rahman University of Management and Technology, led by Vice President Xie Sujuan, visited Nanchang University. Liu Chengmei, Vice President of Nanchang University,...
data.text:
On September 8, a delegation from Tunku Abdul Rahman University of Management and Technology, led by Vice President Xie Sujuan, visited Nanchang University. Liu Chengmei, Vice President of Nanchang University, met with the guests.

Liu Chengmei welcomed the delegation and introduced the recent development of Nanchang University. He hoped that, within the framework of the cooperation agreement, both universities could enhance more specific and in-depth cooperation and exchange in various fields.

Tunku Abdul Rahman University of Management and Technology was founded in 1969 and is named after Tunku Abdul Rahman, the founding father of Malaysia. Renowned for nurturing high-quality academic and professional talents, the university is one of the leading institutions of higher education in Malaysia and has produced more than 40% of Malaysia's accountants.

Also present at the meeting were directors from Office of International Affairs, International Education College, School of Economics and Management, School of Resources and Environment, Architecture and Design College, and School of Infrastructure Engineering.
